706825f-a.title: Brooklyn: Somers Street - Sackman Street
706825f-a.text:
152-170 Somers Street, south side, between Sackman Street and Broadway.
The two peaked roof homes are very old. They were historically connected
with James Pelling. Pelling's Lane passed these houses connecting Bushwick
Road, (now Ave)., with Jamaica Turnpike, (now Norman Place). The junction
of all B.M.T. Elevated Lines is seen in the background.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
